Major_Arcs.title: Nostalgia and the Looming Threat to Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the central character's longing for the past, the conflict surrounding the ghost town, and the initial reactions to the proposed airport development.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Sentiments and Ghost Town Dispute
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the initial setting in a saloon, introduces key characters, and sets up the contrasting themes of nostalgia for the old west and the immediate conflict regarding visiting the ghost town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Woman's Nostalgia
Bar Conversation and Ghost Town Disagreement

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they both occur within the saloon setting on page 1 and introduce the initial characters and the central theme of nostalgia and the ghost town visit.

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Arrival and Development Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts the focus to the ghost town itself, showing Nan's arrival and the introduction of the modern conflict with the arrival of surveyors and their airport development plans. This scene culminates in Nan overhearing the devastating news about the ghost town's impending destruction.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Solo Ride to Ghost Town
Modern Visitors and Airport Development Plan
Nan Overhears the Airport Plan and Reacts

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 2 and follow Nan's journey to the ghost town and the introduction of the airport development plotline by new characters.

Major_Arcs.title: Personal Reflection, Confrontation, and Business Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc delves into Nan's personal reflections on past relationships, her direct confrontation with the construction workers, and the introduction of business and family conflicts related to the airport project.

sub_scenes.title: Past Relationship and Present Danger
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene juxtaposes Nan's internal reflection on her past relationship with Cal against her immediate and dangerous confrontation with the construction workers at the ghost town. It shows her emotional turmoil and her assertive nature in the face of threat.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they both occur on page 3 and show a contrast between Nan's internal emotional state and her external confrontation related to the ghost town.

sub_scenes.title: Business Discussions and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces business discussions related to the airport project involving Nan, her father, and another older man. It highlights Nan's father's disapproval of the airport, their differing views on business, and escalates into a personal and angry confrontation between Nan and her father, culminating in Nan's emotional breakdown.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Horses and Father's Disapproval

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 4 and showcase the escalating conflict between Nan and her father regarding the airport project and business dealings, leading to Nan's emotional distress.

Major_Arcs.title: Conflicting Advice, Determined Action, and Relationship Ultimatum
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan receiving conflicting advice from various figures, her resolve to seek clarity from Cal, and her business involvement with the airport project, culminating in a direct ultimatum to Cal regarding their relationship and the horses.

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Counsel and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan receiving varying advice from her mother, father, and a maid, highlighting the different perspectives surrounding her relationship with Cal and the airport situation. It culminates in Nan's decision to take action and seek direct answers from Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Determination and Pursuit of Cal
Business Deal with Cowboys and Urgency

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 5 and show Nan grappling with different advice, becoming determined to act, and revealing her business involvement related to the airport.

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Ultimatum and Cal's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents a direct confrontation between Nan and Cal where Nan issues an ultimatum related to their relationship and the horses. Cal's defiant response and subsequent departure mark a significant turning point in their relationship and the immediate narrative.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they occur on page 6 and depict the climax and immediate aftermath of Nan's confrontation with Cal, resulting in his departure.

Major_Arcs.title: Time, Loneliness, and Weather Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the passage of time after Cal's departure, Nan's growing loneliness and regret, her belated confession, and the sudden emergence of a severe weather crisis that overshadows personal conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Loneliness and Belated Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the passage of time and Nan's growing loneliness following Cal's departure. It culminates in Nan's decision to pursue Cal and confess her true feelings, driven by regret and a desire for reconciliation.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 6 and 7 and focus on Nan's emotional journey after Cal leaves, leading to her confession and Cal's confused reaction.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Warning and Community Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks a dramatic shift from personal emotions to an external crisis: a severe snowstorm. It depicts the interruption of Nan and Cal's personal interaction by the weather warning and the growing community concern over the cattle and their livelihood.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 7 and depict the sudden emergence and escalating impact of the severe weather crisis on the community.

Major_Arcs.title: Despair, Hope, and Pragmatic Realism in the Face of Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc illustrates the emotional rollercoaster of the community as they grapple with the snowstorm. It moves from despair and hopelessness to a glimmer of hope with the cessation of snow, only to be plunged back into despair with renewed snowfall. Finally, it culminates in the arrival of the fodder plane, bringing relief and a shift to pragmatic realism.

sub_scenes.title: Hopelessness and Fleeting Relief
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene captures the fluctuating emotions of the community as they deal with the snowstorm. It begins with a statement of despair, transitions to a brief moment of hope when the snow stops, and quickly reverts back to despair with renewed snowfall.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they occur on page 8 and depict the shifting moods of despair and fleeting hope related to the snowstorm.

sub_scenes.title: Hope from Above and Grounded Assessment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks a turning point with the arrival of the fodder plane, bringing much-needed relief and hope. However, it also includes a shift to a more pragmatic assessment of the situation, acknowledging both the help received and the ongoing challenges.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: The Fodder Plane
Assessing the Situation and Lingering Concerns

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they occur on page 8 and showcase the shift from despair to hope with the fodder plane, followed by a more realistic evaluation of the situation.

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction and Conflicting Perspectives on Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the character of Chane Benson, establishing him as a figure of both danger and allure. It explores different perspectives on his character, contrasting youthful admiration for brute force with more mature views valuing civilization and intellect.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Forceful Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a display of force, knocking a man down in the street. It establishes his persona as dangerous and captivating through the reactions of bystanders.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dangerous Casanova's Display of Force
Conflicting Views on Chane Benson's Heroism and Manners
Beyond Brute Force: Maturity and Civilization

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 9 and collectively introduce and characterize Chane Benson through his actions and varied opinions about him.

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Mother-Son Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Jeff's unhealthy fascination with guns and violence, stemming from childhood hero worship. It depicts his mother's concern and attempts to guide him, leading to a confrontation and escalating tension over his behavior and the influence of figures like Chane Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Childhood Roots of Gun Obsession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene explores the origins of Jeff's fascination with guns by delving into his childhood hero worship and linking it to his current unhealthy obsession with violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing about Brother Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they occur on page 10 and both focus on establishing the background and current concerns related to Jeff's gun obsession.

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Confrontation and Escalating Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a direct confrontation between Jeff and his mother regarding his gun handling and behavior. It escalates into an emotional exchange involving another man, comparisons to Chane Benson, and a sarcastic suggestion of violence, highlighting the growing tension and conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Initiating a Talk about Jeff's Gun Handling
Mother's Disappointment and Desire for Decency
Comparison to Chane Benson and Criticism of Clyde Surrett
Defense of Chane Benson and Mocking Duel with Clyde Surrett

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 10 and depict the escalating confrontation between Jeff and his mother, involving gun handling, parental disappointment, and comparisons to Chane Benson.

Major_Arcs.title: Mother's Resolve, Reassurance, and Looming Danger
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the mother's determination to help Jeff, her reassurance from Clyde, their shared hope for the future, and the narrative shift that foreshadows impending trouble for Jeff, despite their efforts.

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Resolve and Shared Responsibility
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the mother's frustration and resolve to guide Jeff away from Benson's influence, coupled with Clyde's reassurance and acceptance of shared responsibility for Jeff's upbringing.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Shared Responsibility for Jeff's Upbringing
Affection and Hope for Future Happiness

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur at the beginning of page 11 and show the mother and Clyde's shared concern and plan for Jeff, contrasted with Jeff's defiance.

sub_scenes.title: Narrative Foreshadowing and Benson's Unsettling Presence
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to a narrative voice foreshadowing impending trouble for Jeff, despite the couple's hopes. It introduces Mr. Benson in a scene with Sally, and then provides a descriptive narrative of Chane Benson's unsettling demeanor, creating a sense of unease and foreboding.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Blissful Ignorance and Looming Trouble
Advice from Mr. Benson to Sally
Chane Benson's Cold Demeanor and Silent Observation
Rejection of Brother's Influence and Disdain for Young Boys

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 11 and shift from the intimate scene of the mother and Clyde to narrative foreshadowing and the introduction of Chane Benson's unsettling presence and influence.

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation with Benson and Clyde's Stand
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts a direct confrontation with Chane Benson, initiated by Surrett and escalated by Clyde. It showcases Clyde's determination to fight against Benson's negative influence and protect the town, despite potential skepticism from others.

sub_scenes.title: Direct Questioning of Benson's Intentions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Surrett confronting Chane Benson directly, demanding to know his purpose in Juniper town, setting the stage for a tense exchange.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Questioning of Benson's Intentions
Benson's Evasive Response and Assertion of Staying
Clyde's Intervention and Warning to Benson

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur at the beginning of page 12 and depict the escalating confrontation with Chane Benson, starting with Surrett's questioning and culminating in Clyde's intervention and warning.

sub_scenes.title: Clyde's Resolve and Determination
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the aftermath of the confrontation, focusing on Surrett's concern and Clyde's firm reassurance about Benson's dangerous nature. It highlights Clyde's determination to act against Benson, even if others are skeptical.

narrative_arcs.title: Surrett's Further Inquiry and Clyde's Resolve to Stay
Clyde's Declaration of Action and Protection

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 12 and depict the private conversation between Surrett and Clyde, emphasizing Clyde's resolve to confront Benson and protect the town.

Major_Arcs.title: Sally's Misguided Faith and Dinner Deception
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Sally's misguided attempt to resolve the conflict with Chane Benson through courtesy and a dinner invitation. It shows her influence over Jeff, the deceptive calm of the dinner, and the escalating tensions that ultimately lead to violence and confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Misplaced Hope
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Sally proposing a dinner invitation to Chane Benson as a way to resolve conflict peacefully. It shows Jeff's reaction and the narrative's commentary on Sally's faith and the potential futility of her approach.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Benson and Dinner Invitation
Narrative Reflection on Decency and Courtesy
Narrative Time Skip and Jeff's Shift in Viewpoint
Dinner Shooting Demonstration and Sally's Concern

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 13 and depict the sequence of events leading to and during the dinner invitation to Chane Benson, highlighting Sally's misguided hope for a peaceful resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's End and Outdoor Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the conclusion of the dinner and the shift to an outdoor setting where tensions erupt. It shows Jeff's jealousy, Benson's aggressive accusations, and escalating physical interactions, culminating in Sally's rebuff and condemnation of Benson.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 14 and depict the events following the dinner, showcasing escalating tensions and confrontations leading to Sally's clear stance against Benson.

Major_Arcs.title: Violence, Escape, and Showdown with Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalation to physical violence between Jeff and Benson, Sally's reaction, and Jeff's escape and subsequent confrontation with Benson. It culminates in a physical fight where Jeff defeats Benson, resolving the immediate conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Violence and Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the immediate escalation to violence, with verbal provocations leading to a physical fight between Jeff and Benson. It shows Sally's alarm, Jeff's apparent injury, and the urgent need to escape to warn Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane Benson's Provocation and Jeff's Anger
Sally's Urgency and the Escape Plan

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 15 and depict the rapid escalation of violence and the initial escape efforts following the dinner confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Final Showdown and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the final showdown between Jeff and Chane Benson. It includes their agreement to a fistfight, the anxious wait of Sally and Clyde, and Jeff's victorious return, culminating in a sense of relief and a hopeful outlook for the future.

narrative_arcs.title: Headline Change and Relief at Return

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 16 and depict the final confrontation between Jeff and Benson, leading to Jeff's victory and a sense of resolution.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles, New Hire, and Lingering Concerns
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts the scene to a ranch setting and introduces new characters and conflicts related to ranch management and potential threats. It focuses on the hiring of Steve Daley, initial ranch concerns, and the unfolding mystery of 'Hank's orders'.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and New Arrival
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene opens with a physical confrontation on a ranch, setting a tone of conflict. It then introduces Steve Daley as a new hire and his introduction to 'the boss', establishing new characters and a new setting.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and the Boss
Explanation of Steve's Hiring and Approval

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 17 and introduce the ranch setting, a physical confrontation, and the arrival and explanation of Steve Daley's hiring.

sub_scenes.title: Town Trip and Ranch Worries
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows 'Long Lady' on a trip to town, ostensibly to carry out 'Hank's orders', while also depicting discussions about ranch concerns, potential range wars, and doubts about Steve Daley's judgment.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 18 and depict the concurrent events of 'Long Lady' going to town and discussions about ranch troubles and concerns about Steve Daley.

Major_Arcs.title: Town Conflict and 'Long Lady's' Assertiveness
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on 'Long Lady's' experiences in town, starting with observations and gossip about her, escalating to a direct confrontation with antagonists, showcasing her skill in physical altercation and assertive nature.

sub_scenes.title: Town Observation and Initial Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts 'Long Lady' in town being observed and discussed by Fred Bridges and the hired hand, highlighting initial skepticism and gossip surrounding her arrival and Steve Daley's judgment.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 19 and depict 'Long Lady's' experience in town, from initial observation to a physical altercation and its immediate aftermath.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Authority, Romantic Development, and Business Clarification
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc returns to the ranch and focuses on Betsy asserting her authority regarding gunmen, her developing romantic feelings for Steve Daley, and clarifying business matters with her father, leading to a romantic climax and resolution of their initial conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Ranch Rule and Father's Agreement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy asserting her authority on the ranch, declaring she won't have gunmen, and gaining her father's agreement and recognition of her as the boss.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 20 and depict Betsy asserting her authority on the ranch and the initial romantic development between Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Conflict and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the romantic conflict between Betsy and Steve regarding his profession as a gunfighter and culminates in a resolution where Steve agrees to give up his guns for Betsy, leading to a romantic climax with a kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love and the Dilemma of Profession

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 21 and depict the development and resolution of the romantic conflict between Betsy and Steve, culminating in a kiss.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Confrontation and Steve's Past
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts back to external conflict with Bridges confronting Betsy about ranch issues, while also delving into Steve's internal reflections on his past, hinting at deeper motivations and backstory.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Trespass and Hostile Standoff
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Bridges confronting Betsy and her father about trespassing and missing cattle, creating a hostile standoff and setting up potential conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Bridges and his Men

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they both occur on page 22, contrasting the external confrontation with Bridges and Steve's internal reflection on his past.

Major_Arcs.title: Steve's Return to Violence and Devil's Pass Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Steve's decision to abandon peaceful means and return to violence to resolve the conflict. It shows his departure for Devil's Pass, Betsy's pursuit, and the violent confrontation at Devil's Pass, leading to Betsy being caught in the crossfire.

sub_scenes.title: Decision for Violence and Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Steve's decision to arm himself and resolve the conflict through violence, despite Betsy's pleas. It depicts his departure for Devil's Pass and Betsy's initial reaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Decision to Arm Himself and Go to Devil's Pass
Betsy's Realization and Pursuit of Steve

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they both occur on page 23 and depict Steve's decision to resort to violence and Betsy's subsequent pursuit of him.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Violence and Betsy's Injury
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the violent confrontation at Devil's Pass, with Steve demanding the gunslinger to appear. It shows the eruption of gunfire and Betsy being caught in the crossfire and injured.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 24 and depict the violent confrontation at Devil's Pass and the immediate aftermath, including Betsy's injury and reconciliation with Steve.

Major_Arcs.title: Unrelated Argument and Ranch Trouble Introduction
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces seemingly unrelated conflicts in different settings: an argument between a woman and a man about 'Dave', and then shifts to a new ranch setting where trouble is brewing with neighboring ranchers.

sub_scenes.title: Argument over 'Dave'
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents an isolated argument between a woman and a man, focused on the man's actions towards someone named 'Dave', seemingly unrelated to the main plotlines so far.
sub_scenes.justification: This arc is a standalone scene on page 25, presenting an isolated argument.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Trouble and Range Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new ranch setting and a new conflict: trouble with neighboring ranchers ('Bar F Fenin' men) encroaching on their north range, setting up a range war scenario.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubling News at the Ranch
Discussion Among Intruders and Threat of Gunplay

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 25 and 26 and depict the introduction and resolution of the range conflict with the 'Bar F Fenin' ranchers.

Major_Arcs.title: Personal Reconciliation and Lingering Tension with Fred
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on personal reconciliation between Dave and Carrie, resolving their immediate conflict. However, it also introduces a new tension with Fred Gordon, hinting at unresolved feelings and potential future conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Dave and Carrie's Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dave and Carrie's reconciliation, with Dave apologizing and Carrie offering reassurance and a positive outlook for their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Fred and Brotherly Matters
Carrie's Introspective Thoughts on Love and Anticipation
Intrusion and Questioning by Fred Gordon

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 27 and depict Dave and Carrie's reconciliation and the re-introduction of Fred Gordon, hinting at lingering tensions.

Major_Arcs.title: Misunderstandings, Fondness, and a Proposal Amidst Past Relationships
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on resolving misunderstandings between Dave and Carrie, clarifying their feelings and past relationships, and culminating in a marriage proposal, despite the backdrop of past romantic entanglements with Fred Gordon.

sub_scenes.title: Clearing Misunderstandings and Expressing Fondness
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dave and Carrie clearing up misunderstandings about their feelings and past relationships, with Carrie expressing fondness for Dave despite past connections with Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Rebuttal and Declaration of Love
Desire for Reconciliation and Invitation for Relaxation
Carrie's Reflective Thoughts on Love for Fred and His Qualities
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Marriage Proposal

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 28 and depict the resolution of misunderstandings between Dave and Carrie, culminating in a marriage proposal and acceptance.

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Contract Conflict and Emotional Fallout
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the conflict surrounding the Carlton contract, its impact on Dave and Carrie's relationship, Carrie's emotional outburst, and her subsequent realization and reconciliation with Dave and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract Confrontation and Emotional Anger
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie confronting Dave about the Carlton contract, accusing him of prioritizing business over their relationship, leading to an emotional outburst and accusations of deception.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusation of Deception and Plea of Love
Confrontation with Dave, Pete, and Fred

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 29 and depict the escalating conflict related to the Carlton contract and Carrie's emotional response and confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Emotional Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie confronting Carlton directly in his office, asserting her independence and clarifying her motivations. It then transitions to a waiting room scene where Carrie has an emotional release and seeks comfort from Dave, followed by a moment of reflection and reconciliation with both Dave and Fred.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 30 and depict the resolution of the Carlton contract conflict, Carrie's confrontation with Carlton, and her subsequent emotional release and reconciliation with Dave and Fred.

Major_Arcs.title: Fred's Pain, Chance Encounter, and Confession of Love (Again)
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Fred's emotional pain after Carrie's words, a chance encounter between Dave and Carrie, and a renewed confession of love from Carrie to Fred, driven by the revelation about the beef contract.

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Emotional Turmoil
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Fred's internal reflection on Carrie's harsh words and their deep emotional impact on him, emphasizing his pain and vulnerability.
sub_scenes.justification: This arc is a standalone scene on page 31, focused entirely on Fred's internal emotional state.

sub_scenes.title: Chance Encounter and Confession of Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a chance encounter between Dave and Carrie in town, leading to Dave questioning Carrie about her feelings for Fred and Carrie ultimately confessing her love for Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Chance Encounter and Emotional Inquiry in Town

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 31 and depict the chance encounter between Dave and Carrie and Carrie's confession of love for Fred.

Major_Arcs.title: Revelation of Truth, Flashback, and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the revelation of the truth about the beef contract, prompting Carrie to reflect on her past shame and regret. It culminates in Carrie and Fred's emotional reunion and romantic reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: Beef Contract Revelation and Carrie's Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie's sickbed scene, her anticipation of a visitor, and the arrival of Mr. Carlton and the young man who reveal the truth about the beef contract being rightfully Carrie's father's.

narrative_arcs.title: Young Man's Confession and Carrie's Initial Reaction
Carrie's Flashback of Shame, Regret, and Happiness

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 32 and depict the revelation about the beef contract, Carrie's emotional flashback, and her romantic reunion with Fred.

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Wounded Arrival, Care, and Escape
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new conflict with Dirk's wounded arrival, Carrie's care for him, and the revelation of his gunshot wound. It focuses on the immediate aftermath of Dirk's injury and the community's response.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injured Arrival and Childhood Care
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Dirk's unexpected and wounded arrival, startling Carrie. It then shifts to an outdoor setting where Carrie tends to his wounds, recalling their shared history and her care for him since childhood.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 33 and depict Dirk's wounded arrival, Carrie's care, and the medical examination of his gunshot wound.

Major_Arcs.title: Investigation, Confrontation, and Revelation of Dirk's Crime
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc involves the investigation into Dirk's situation, Rance Cready's arrival and confrontation at the ranch, and the revelation of Dirk's crime and the lawman's duty to apprehend him.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Suspicion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the old man's concern about Dirk's injury and his decision to investigate further, suspecting foul play.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Encounter with Chris Ransome
Escalating Tension and Accusation at the Ranch

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 34 and depict the investigation into Dirk's situation and Rance Cready's arrival and confrontation at the ranch.

sub_scenes.title: Revelation of Crime and Negotiation for Custody
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Dirk's crime – killing a man and fleeing. It then depicts the negotiation between the lawman and a woman (likely Dirk's associate) regarding Dirk's custody, leading to a temporary agreement.

narrative_arcs.title: Negotiation for Dirk's Custody and Care

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they both occur on page 35 and depict the revelation of Dirk's crime and the subsequent negotiation for his custody between the lawman and a woman.

Major_Arcs.title: Lawman's Internal Shift and Emotional Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the lawman's internal emotional shift and his complex interaction with the woman (Chris). It explores his changing feelings, their tense conversation, and hints at a deeper, possibly romantic, connection.

sub_scenes.title: Lawman's Internal Transformation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the lawman's internal reflection, highlighting a significant emotional shift and changing perspective regarding the situation and potentially towards the woman.

narrative_arcs.title: Lawman's Internal Conflict and Shifting Perspective

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they both occur on page 35 and focus on the lawman's internal emotional shift and his tense interaction with the woman, hinting at unspoken feelings.

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Confession, Reassurance, and Escape Plan
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the romantic confession between Chris and Rance, their initial joy and doubt, and the subsequent revelation of Chris's hidden agenda to help Dirk escape, leading to Rance's rejection of her plan.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Initial Doubt
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the romantic confession between Chris and Rance, starting with Chris expressing her love and initial disbelief at Rance reciprocating, followed by Rance's reassurance.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Desire and Lingering Doubt
Realization of Rejection and Internal Conflict
Confrontation about Intentions and Daybreak Departure

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 36 and depict the romantic confession, Chris's doubts, Rance's reassurance, and the revelation of Chris's escape plan and Rance's rejection of it.

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit, Violent Confrontation, and Escape to Mexico
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the active pursuit of Dirk and Chris by the Marshal, the violent confrontation that ensues, Chris shooting someone, and their desperate escape attempt, culminating in Dirk reaching Mexico and Rance's determination to follow.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and Deadly Ultimatum
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the pursuit of Dirk and Chris by the Marshal, confirming their flight and the escalating danger. It culminates in the Marshal's deadly ultimatum.
sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 37 and depict the escalating chase and the Marshal's deadly ultimatum, setting up the violent confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Shootout and Desperate Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the violent shootout, Chris shooting someone, Rance's distressed reaction, and the immediate aftermath, with Chris tending to a wounded Dirk and the Marshal proposing a desperate escape plan.

narrative_arcs.title: Justification for Deadly Force and Injury Assessment
Desperate Escape Plan and Moral Objection

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 37 and depict the violent shootout, its immediate consequences, and the desperate escape plan.

sub_scenes.title: Escape to Mexico and Rance's Determined Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dirk and Chris's escape attempt, their separation at the border, Chris's return to Rance, and Rance's determined, though injured, pursuit of Dirk to Mexico, culminating in their reunion.

narrative_arcs.title: Parting Ways and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 38 and depict the escape attempt, the parting of ways, and Rance's injured but determined pursuit of Dirk to Mexico, ending with their reunion.

Major_Arcs.title: Rance's Recovery, Romantic Reunion, and Wedding Day Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Rance's recovery, his romantic reunion with Chris, and their wedding day. It brings together the romantic and action storylines, culminating in a wedding ceremony that resolves the immediate conflicts and provides a happy ending.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Chris finding Rance injured, his recovery under his father's care, and their romantic reunion with confessions of love and a marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Sleepless Vigil and Lingering Danger
Father's Tactful Exit and Anticipation of Private Discussion
Clarification of Father's Integrity and Dirk's Involvement
Declaration of Gratitude and Undying Affection

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 39 and depict Rance's recovery, his romantic reunion with Chris, and their engagement.

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Unexpected Reunion with Dirk
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to the wedding day, showing the bride's reflections and anticipation, her father's approach, and then Dirk's unexpected and disruptive arrival at the wedding, leading to a tense confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Acclamation and Anecdotal Praise for Rance

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 40 and depict the wedding day events, from the bride's anticipation to Dirk's unexpected arrival and the resolution with the Marshal's explanation and gift, culminating in a celebratory tone.
